title: How Many Calories in Cinnamon?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in cinnamon per teaspoon, including carbs, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown for ground spice use.
assumptions: Ground cinnamon; standard serving size of 1 tsp (≈2.6 g); no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (Ceylon vs. Cassia), brand, freshness, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of ground cinnamon contains about 6 calories, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with spice packaging.

tweaks.label: Use 1 tbsp instead of 1 tsp (3x amount)
Add to oatmeal with 1 tsp sugar

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tsp of cinnamon?
faqs.a: Approximately 6 calories per teaspoon of ground cinnamon.

faqs.q: Does cinnamon have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: Yes, about 2.1 g carbs and 1.4 g fiber per tsp, with minimal sugars.

faqs.q: Is cinnamon low calorie for baking?
faqs.a: Very low at 6 kcal per tsp, making it a calorie-friendly flavor enhancer.

faqs.q: How many calories in a cinnamon stick?
faqs.a: A 3-inch stick (≈1 g) has about 2-3 kcal; ground is more concentrated.
Serving size and form (ground vs. stick); additives like sugar increase totals.
